results.title: Chinese Diggers
results.creator_credit: Teck Tan, Margaret Smith and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
A Prizewinner at the 31st International Film and TV Festival of New York this program looks at Australia’s attitude to Chinese Australians who wanted to join the Armed Forces to assist in the defence of Australia during the Second World War. In examining the stories of those interviewed a number of issues are brought to light. The video is accompanied by Teacher’s notes and workcards.

results.title: Old Songs in a New Land: A Piece of Jewish Australian ...
results.creator_credit: Judy Menczel, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Inspired by an exhibition of the same name held at Hyde Park Barracks, Sydney 1988 and organised by the Bicentennial Committee, NSW Jewish Board of Deputies, this video portrays the history of the Jews in Australia from those who arrived on the First Fleet to the Jewish immigrants from Russia of the present day. Interviews with representatives of the Jewish community highlight the differences which still exist within the community which yet retains a distinctively Jewish character.
results.title_for_label: Old Songs in a New Land: A Piece of Jewish Australian …

results.title: Hungry Ghosts
results.creator_credit: Zi Zhong Wang, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
During Adelaide’s Chinese cultural week in 1988 a group of puppeteers from Adelaide’s sister city of Penang were invited to present one of their plays in honour of the Festival of Hungry Ghosts which fell at this time. The program shows their ritualistic preparations and some of the other festivities which took place.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Zi Zhong Wang, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV

results.title: Saigon Doctor
results.creator_credit: Georgia Allen, Kathryn Millard and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
A dramatised story of a young Vietnamese doctor who has come to Australia with his wife and child, only to find his medical qualifications are unrecognised here. He therefore enrols in a requalification course a long way from his family. As well as exploring the issue of recognition of overseas qualifications the video also focuses on the young man’s feelings of isolation, frustration, deprivation and development of a sense of community. As well as building on the social issues raised by the video, the accompanying Teacher’s notes also show how the video can be used in drama production.
results.description:

As well as building on the social issues raised by the video, the accompanying Teacher’s notes also show how the video can be used in drama production.

As well as building on the social issues raised by the video, the accompanying Teacher’s notes also show how the video can be used in drama production.

results.title: Being True Blue
results.creator_credit: Kay Donovan, Australia. Office of Multicultural Affairs and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
This documentary explores what it means to be an Australian citizen and just what a new citizen is welcome to. In interviews with historians, social planners and ordinary people, ‘Being True Blue’ looks behind the facade of the national anthem, the sports hero, the bushman and the other cheap barometers of identity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kay Donovan, Australia. Office of Multicultural Affairs and SBS-TV
results.description:

results.title: Days of Stargazey Pie
results.creator_credit: Margaret Haselgrove, Australia. Office of Multicultural Affairs and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Cornish descendants, a tourist guide and a historian talk about the contribution that the Cornish miners made to the development of the South Australian copper mines at Burra and Moonta. We also look at some of their traditions which have been handed down from generation to generation in this ‘Little Cornwall”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Margaret Haselgrove, Australia. Office of Multicultural Affairs and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service

results.title: Threads of Ireland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
This program looks at the traditions and culture brought to Australia by the Irish Catholic convicts, and the way in which the Irish influence is still present in modern Australia. Explores the history of Australian writing, music and religion which have an Irish influence.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
This program looks at the traditions and culture brought to Australia by the Irish Catholic convicts, and the way in which the Irish influence is still present in modern Australia. Explores the history of Australian writing, music and religion which have an Irish influence.

results.title: Miss Marple Series
results.brief_description: A series of films adapted from Agatha Christie’s books featuring Miss Marple, a sweet little old lady who lives in the village of St. Mary Mead and happens to be one of England’s greatest detectives! Each story, as well as being a murder mystery, also depicts English village life between the wars. Stars Joan Hickson as Miss Marple.
results.description: A series of films adapted from Agatha Christie’s books featuring Miss Marple, a sweet little old lady who lives in the village of St. Mary Mead and happens to be one of England’s greatest detectives! Each story, as well as being a murder mystery, also depicts English village life between the wars. Stars Joan Hickson as Miss Marple.

results.title: They do it with mirrors
results.creator_credit: Norman Stone, George Gallaccio, Arts and Entertainment Network and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Miss Marple Series”.
Miss Marple’s keen powers of observation and detection are put to good use at Stonygates, the rambling country house where her friend Carrie-Louise (Jean Simmons) and husband Lewis run a reformatory for young criminals. Shots are fired in a dark room but the victim is discovered elsewhere. Miss Marple soon identifies the killer. Once again, Joan Hickson plays the ever popular Miss Marple.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman Stone, George Gallaccio, Arts and Entertainment Network and BBC

results.title: A Caribbean mystery
results.creator_credit: Christopher Petit, George Gallaccio and BBC Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Miss Marple Series”.
Miss Marple, (Joan Hickson) is far away from her home in quiet St. Mary Mead. However, even in the tropical paradise of the Caribbean, her powers of observation and keen understanding of human nature is required to solve the murder of Major Pulgrave at the Golden Palm Hotel. When others become victims to the unknown murderer she knows it’s vital for her to crack the case. Also stars Donald Pleasence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher Petit, George Gallaccio and BBC Enterprises
